intro: Bartsia abyssinica var. petitiana, commonly known as the Abyssinian bartsia, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. This variety is distinguished by its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations to its native habitat.
